definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse

sentences.english: Player must shoot the attackers of zombi .
sentences.chinese: 玩家必须射杀那些丧尸。

sentences.english: He'd watched them on the monitor and thought how like zombies they were.
sentences.chinese: 他从监视器里看着他们，想着他们多么像丧尸。

sentences.english: Kill 25 player controlled zombies with a melee attack.
sentences.chinese: 用近战杀死25名玩家控制的丧尸。

sentences.english: 'The Walking Dead' will be back for a third season of zombie goodness.
sentences.chinese: 我们将能看到超好看丧尸美剧《形式走肉》的第三季。

sentences.english: They make us feel like a zombie apocalypse could hit us any moment.
sentences.chinese: 这些人让我们觉得丧尸危机随时可能在我们身边爆发。

sentences.english: Zombies are officially the new vampires.
sentences.chinese: 丧尸正式成为新版吸血鬼。

definition: leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers
